captions.text: Meet me in the gazebo at midnight, and don't bring anyone.
Oh hello! I didn't see you there.
I would have seen you if you were a car though.
Did you know they're over two hundred and 40 million cars in the United States alone? That's like, a whole bunch.
Which makes me wonder...
What if we stopped driving?
First and foremost thirty three thousand lives could have possibly been saved.
That many people were killed by cars in the U.S. in 2012.
Making your car one of the most dangerous places you can put your little body.
That's like a college football stadium full of people.
Imagine a stadium full of people who just cheated death. Look how happy they are.
Beyonce is performing for them... for free!
When's the last time you heard that word?
We're constantly flushing money into our cars.
Car payments, and gas, maintenance... it sure adds up.
To on average 10,181 dollars a year per person in the U.S.
Now multiply that by all the registered cars in the United States.
That is a whole lot of dough!
There is some bad news though...
The U.S. automotive industry employs approximately 3.9 million people.
If we stopped driving cars we'd also stop buying them. So those fine folks would be out of a job... but only temporarily.
With cars out of the picture the entire population would have to use public transportation.
More systems would need to be built and maintained resulting in... You guessed it! More jobs.
You're so smart!
According to a recent study public transportation allowed commuters to save about 21 billion dollars in 2012 nationally.
That's 42 million iPads! You could build a mansion only using iPads.
It's not just your money that would be saved. If people stopped driving altogether we would be relieving the environment of a great stress.
Every step of a car's life has an enormous environmental foot print. No cars means no footprint! Which means more trees and shade and flowers.
Studies show that transportation emissions account for 1/3 of the U.S. air pollution.
So without cars the sky would be 1/3 more clear.
That means people in LA might be able to see the beach... might.
It's also widely believed that many wars are fought for oil... Oil we need to power our cars!
Am I saying without cars there'd be no war?
I'm not... but without cars we would only fight for the most important reasons, like which way is the right way to hang the toilet paper roll?
Well there you have it! Fewer cars better earth! So maybe just ride a bike next time.
Yes hello driver? Bring the car around please.
Thank you so much.
